Package models

Class UserImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.UserImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    User
    public class UserImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements User
    This class represents a single user. User has a unique name and can have portfolios. Creating a user is required to perform all the operations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UserImpl​(java.lang.String userName)
      This constructor creates a user with a given username.
      UserImpl​(java.lang.String userName, float balance)
      This constructor creates a user with given username and initial balance.

      • UserImpl

        public UserImpl​(java.lang.String userName)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor creates a user with a given username. Note: Username must not contain the following characters: {}[],:"\ This constructor is user while loading a user from file system.
        Parameters:
        userName - String which is unique for a user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a userName is already taken.

      • UserImpl

        public UserImpl​(java.lang.String userName,
                float balance)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor creates a user with given username and initial balance. This constructor is called which creating a user from the program.
        Parameters:
        userName - String username which is unique for a user.
        balance - float balance which is entered by the user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if username is already taken or if the balance is invalid.
